review: I love Amazon. I love my Kindle Fire and my Fire Phone. I really wanted to love this too, but I hate the Fire stick. I purchased it during their 2 day sale for $19. That is easily the worst money I have spent. A year and a half ago my family gave up satellite television. To save money, we went to complete streaming with Netflix, Hulu Plus, and Amazon Prime. We started streaming through the Wii, but did not like the Wii controls for watching tv. We then purchased the original Roku. We loved it.  Remote functions were easier to use. It was dependable, and the menus were easy to use.After we mounted our flat screen on the wall, I purchased the Fire Stick. It was on sale so the price definitely a draw. Also I liked the idea of not having everything visible. (The Roku is small, but it is still visible.) Unfortunately, we have never liked it. It still has a power cord that is visible. The menu is a pain in the butt to operate. Everything you do on the Amazon Prime part has to have a pin, even if it is free through prime. This is a terrible feature if you have children. It freezes constantly when streaming. It will quit completely while the Roku in another room is working perfectly.Bottom line, save your money and get Roku instead.
